job_title: Data Science Manager (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
required_skills: Data Science, User Experience (UX), and User Interface DesignBusiness Insights, Cluster Analysis, Cost Engineering, Market Analysis, Neural Networks, Predictive Modeling, and Quantitative Data
location: Agoda · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 weeks ago  · 10 applicants
job_description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.


The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.


We think of Data Science in Agoda differently. For us, a data scientist is a fusion of core production skills with analytic and business skills. We’ve brought top talents from (literally) all over the world who focus relentlessly on building products which utilize ML and AI as their main edge. We know that when you infuse ML and technology, you move from good to great and that is our mission. Our Data Science managers are action driven leaders that can form vivid vision and successfully direct their people to execute it while being strongly rooted in the details and practice.

As a Data Science Manager, you will:

You are a developer of people. You love leading diverse teams of professionals with both qualitative and quantitative backgrounds using data-driven and insights-led approaches to respond quickly in a dynamic, competitive, and fast changing industry.

Tackle complex problems in the online travel and ecommerce space using a range of ML and data analysis methods. Use our huge data repositories to push our business metrics to their bounds, directly and indirectly. Foster a culture that constantly raises the bar for us and others and supports the freedom to explore and innovate.

Can we detect causation between metrics and bookings? How can automatically answer our users’ questions? How do we tune our AB testing platform to ensure we aren’t optimizing noise? How do we measure experiment success to properly trade off type I and II errors? What is the ideal caching strategy for prices and how do build an ML model to implement it? How can you detect anomalies within more than one million time-series that we track daily? Can you separate between bots and human traffic? Can you make our across-data-centers replication into smart replication using ML models? These are just a few of the diverse questions we tackle and some which you will lead your team to crack. You will be impacting every aspect of the business and it will require various techniques, from diving deep into data with SQL and Big Data tools, all the way to deploying modern machine learning models.

. Work directly with the heads of the business departments and the product management team. Influence them with compelling product ideas based on data insights that can move the dial on our business.





We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

About This Opportunity

Join our dynamic team as we build a cutting-edge 5G cybersecurity platform to safeguard telecom networks worldwide. These networks play a crucial role in establishing national mission critical networks that will shape the future of the connected world. We are committed to ensuring the safety and security of these networks by providing relevant and up-to-date monitoring and mitigating for potential threats.

Job Description

Technology is an indispensable part of our daily lives. But how do you find the devices that will deliver the best performance for your professional and personal needs?

UL benchmarks help people measure, understand and manage computer hardware performance. We create the industry's most trusted and widely usedis used by hundreds of press publications and millions of gamers, overclockers, and system builders around the world.

We are looking for a. We create the industry's most trusted and widely used benchmarks for desktop computers, notebooks, tablets, smartphones, and VR systems. We are looking for a developer who is able to design, implement and maintain reliable cross-platform solutions using modern working methods and quick release cycles.

You will be working with a team of passionate and highly skilled engineers that take pride in developing high-quality software.



















UL is a global safety science organization with more than a century of expertise and innovation in the fields of product safety testing, inspection and verification services. UL partners with businesses, manufacturers, trade associations, regulatory authorities, and governments to play a key role in the development and harmonization of national and international standards.

job_title: Senior Server Engineer, Hay Day or Brawl Stars
required_skills: Databases, Linux, and Shell ScriptingApplication Servers, Concurrent Programming, Data Architecture, Distributed Systems, Java, Scripting, and Server Side
location: Supercell · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  6 hours ago  · 32 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are now looking for experienced Senior Server Engineers to join either the Hay Day or Brawl Stars team. As a Server Engineer at Supercell, you are an integral member of a game team, working closely with other game developers and focusing on making sure that our hundreds of millions of monthly players get the best, most uninterrupted experience possible. Depending on the game and your own interests, you can focus more on the general game server infrastructure or new game feature development – and sometimes you do both.

Communication between server engineers in different game teams is absolutely vital to our success. Our server engineers frequently share learnings, both successes and failures, across game teams to make each team better. You must be humble, pragmatic and willing to admit and explain your mistakes. That way, the next time something goes wrong, we'll all be better prepared.

If you have experience in developing live systems and using virtualized computing, and you understand what it means to support a system with large user volumes, you might just be the person we're looking for!








Luring you in with glitter, glamour, and gems is not what we seek to do. We develop Supercell as an employer for you to do your best work and to call this the best experience in your professional life.

We want you to enjoy your time here fully, so we structure our compensation and benefits to serve this purpose. It starts with perceiving you as a human being, not a resource.


We are a game company based in Helsinki, Finland, with offices in San Francisco, Seoul and Shanghai. Since our launch in 2010, we've released five games globally – Hay Day, Clash of Clans, Boom Beach, Clash Royale and Brawl Stars.

To make five games, we've killed dozens along the way. That's because we're obsessed with quality. Our goal is to make the best games – played by millions, enjoyed for years and remembered forever. To achieve this goal, we create the best possible teams and give them the freedom and independence that are core to our success.


If you love to think, talk, play and make games, Supercell is the place for you. We're made up of proactive, independent teams with the freedom to do what they think is best for their players, our games and the company.

We know it takes more than independence to make great games, so we also take good care of our people, providing them with the compensation, work environment and resources they need to succeed.


Luckily, moving to Helsinki is easier than you might think. No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end. We're here to make sure the process is as smooth as possible for you, your family and whoever and whatever you're bringing along.

job_description:
About the job
Job Title:

General Counsel

Job Description:

Join our team at Dentsu as an ambitious and experienced legal professional, ready to embrace new challenges and contribute to shaping our success here in Finland and the Baltics. This role is tailor-made for individuals with a keen commercial outlook and comfortable providing professional and strategic support to our Finnish and the Baltics leadership and organization. Be a part of our journey to excellence!


The General Counsel for Finland and the Baltics oversees legal matters at an executive level in Dentsu Finland and Dentsu Baltics. We are looking for a commercial legal executive with experience in fast-paced, customer-focused settings. You should possess experience in industries such as Technology, Media, and Telecommunications (TMT), consumer markets, or other dynamically changing fields. International exposure and a broad legal skill set encompassing commercial law, contract management, IP, IT, data protection, and compliance are crucial. While optional, DPO capabilities are beneficial, and HR-law knowledge is a plus.

The ideal candidate is proactive, hands-on, and solution-oriented. They build strong relationships with local leadership, brands, and networks. People leadership skills are vital, and adaptability in an innovative, fast-paced environment is key. A business mindset aligning with company needs is essential. Reporting primarily to the EMEA Deputy General Counsel and secondarily to the CEO in Finland, the position is based in Helsinki.

The role is currently envisaged to be part-time (3 days/week).






Dentsu Group is a global marketing communications company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the largest advertising and media firms in the world. The company offers a wide range of services in advertising, marketing, communication, and digital media, catering to clients across various industries.

We help clients to win, keep, and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses with the best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. For more information please see: www.dentsu.com.

The dentsu L&C team comprises approximately 250 lawyers and compliance and data protection professionals across the world.


Joining dentsu, you’ll join a team of 48,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures, and experiences.  We offer exciting challenges, a great working environment, memorable experiences, and opportunities to shape your future.


We offer a part-time permanent position with a 6-month probationary period, and you will be based at our office in Helsinki, Finland. We look forward to receiving your application.

For any questions, please contact:

Linda Ye, Talent Acquisition Partner

Linda.ye@dentsu.com

job_title: Master thesis AI for 5G/6G Radio Networks
required_skills: Computer Science, Data Science, Pattern Recognition, Programming, and Programming LanguagesCommunication, Java, Problem Solving, Wireless Engineering, and Wireless Technologies
location: Ericsson · Jorvas, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 31 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Why join Ericsson?

We are a world leader in the rapidly changing environment of communications technology – by providing hardware, software, and services to enable the full value of connectivity.

You’ll play a part in using your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what’s possible. To build never-seen-before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems.

Join a team of like-minded innovators driven to go beyond the status quo to build what’s next.

At Ericsson, you can be an, aand a.

To create connections that

A world where limitless connectivity improves lives, redefines business and pioneers a sustainable future.

Our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions, in a place where co-creation and collaboration are embedded in the walls and where our core values ofandshine through in everything we do.



5G and 6G technologies are developing fast to meet the demands of the future. The growing traffic in wireless networks combined with the emergence of new services and devices leads to new challenges. To address these challenges, new methods involving AI and machine learning are essential.

You will join a team within Ericsson Research focused on developing solutions for future wireless networks. Our work extends to novel applications like AR/VR and industrial use cases, including remote-controlled robots and machines.

While our team is based in Jorvas, Finland, we collaborate closely with Ericsson teams worldwide.

In this master thesis project, you will explore how machine learning can be used to optimize the performance of 5G and 6G networks for time critical communication.



Collaborate with your supervisor around selected features within the dynamic 5G/6G network landscape.

Your mission? To apply the power of machine learning to optimize these features across diverse traffic patterns. You'll use a sophisticated system simulator, meticulously crafted to model various aspects of the wireless network.

You will detail your work in a master's thesis, sharing your discoveries for the teams at Ericsson dedicated to this dynamic field.







Interns who join us will enjoy an outstanding chance to make connections, to make change, to make a real difference. We are always looking for interns to become permanent members of our Ericsson team, so you’ll have the opportunity to discuss your future with us during your internship.

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we cultivate it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.

job_description:
About the job
Orkla Care Finland provides Finnish homes with high-quality products for personal wellbeing, health and wound care, for home care and cleaning, as well as basic garments and underwear that fit the Finnish taste. Sustainability is part of everything we do and we want to make sustainable choices easier. This is why we continually develop products, where we take the environment into account both in production and use. Our most well-known brands are Möller, Nutrilett, Sana-Sol, Jordan, L300, Salvequick, Norlyn, Pierre Robert and Black Horse. In 2021, our turnover amounted to 60 million euros and we had 79 employees.

Are you looking for a new challenge in finance to further develop your skills as a BI & Sales Controller? We are waiting for your application to join our experienced and energetic Finance team in Vantaa!

for developing the Business Intelligence environment and providing the organization with financial insights into the business in a proactive manner.

You will develop the BI landscape, e.g. Power BI & SAP analysis to support business in Finland in order to make data easily available for decision-making, forecasting, and the budget process. There is a strong focus and support in the Orkla group on BI development.

Additionally, your focus will be on monitoring and presenting customer profitability, analyzing campaigns, and supporting with forecasting, on a regular basis and ad hoc. You deepen financial understanding with employees and play an active role in delivering reports and challenging colleagues in the sales department. You support sales to achieve their financial targets and help them in the budget and planning process. You will report to the Finance Manager in Finland.

You are curious and determined, easy to approach, with commitment, engagement and the will to bravely create and contribute to a successful business. You are a team player and react with speed to changing circumstances and working conditions according to business needs.



Essential to your success is relevant experience in BI systems and controlling. If you have worked in an FMCG business, SAP, or D365 FO environment, it will be an asset to you. We expect you to have a relevant education and to be fluent in both written and spoken Finnish and English. Knowledge of Swedish is an advantage. You have a good ability to structure and analyze complex information and make it understandable for employees on all levels. Additionally, you have excellent Excel skills.

As a person, you are structured, analytical, and innovative with a strong drive to develop and the ability to execute.



At Orkla , you are constantly learning – from different brands, experiences, people, markets, parts of the value chain, training, and ways of thinking. We are focused on providing new ways for people to develop different skills and how to use them to enhance the difference you can make – to Orkla brands, to the business, and to the world.

We are committed to providing our employees with a dynamic environment surrounded by credible and trusted brands and countless opportunities to learn and grow. There are many companies to believe Orkla is the right place for you to work, here are some of the reasons why Orkla offers a unique and energizing workplace that encourages both commercial curiosity and freedom to fly.

The ability to work with strong local brands combined with the backdrop of a growing international company, gives our employees the opportunity to really make a difference and see the impact of their work.

We are part of Orkla Health portfolio company, and you can find more information about Health at https://www.orklahealth.com/

Locally, we operate under the name Orkla Care Finland which is formed by two companies: Orkla Care Oy and Pierre Robert Oy. Find out more about our local businesses:

https://www.orkla.fi/tietoa-meista/orkla-care-finland/






For further information on this exciting role, reach out to Mika Häkkinen, Finance Manager, by phone +358 40 722 4219 on Thursday 26th October at 14-15, Tuesday 31st of October at 15-16, or Thursday 9th of November at 15-16.

About the job
The worldwide data management software market is massive (IDC forecasts it to be $136 billion by 2027!). At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.



We’re looking for a hardworking, driven individual with superb energy, passion and initiative for new business acquisition. The Enterprise Account Executive role focuses exclusively on formulating and executing a sales strategy within an assigned territory, resulting in revenue growth and new customer acquisition.



MongoDB is always developing and innovating — not only in our technology, but also in our sales go-to-market strategy. Our sales leadership is committed to building the best salesforce in technology. This means, inspiring and enabling success for everyone on the team. We not only equip you to be successful and close deals, but we want your feedback and input on how we can continue to “Think Big and Go Far.” As a crucial part of the Sales team at MongoDB, you will have access to a lucrative market and learn how to sell from some of the most successful sales leaders in the software industry.

















To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.

MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

In this position you will need to be able take ownership of your own work and manage multiple responsibilities and tasks concurrently while remaining focused on the key priorities. Learn about our Rewarding and our Ways of working

job_title: Senior Backend Engineer, Shelf Product Recognition (Python)
required_skills: Back-End Web Development, Databases, and Python (Programming Language)Application Programming Interfaces (API), Data Ingestion, Django, Go (Programming Language), Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, and Server Side

job_description:
About the job
**This role could also be based in our Warsaw office**

At Scandit, we are developing smart data capture technology that enables smart devices to capture data from barcodes, IDs, text and objects. Our newest product, ShelfView, is a machine learning-powered platform for retail that enables real time shelf visibility and empowers more intelligent and efficient store operations. With our scalable data capture technology via robots and mobile devices, retailers are on track to save tens of millions in operating expense and in turn generate tens of million more in value for their customers. For more information, please check our product website.

We are now looking for a new colleague to join the ShelfView team and work on providing a scalable backend to power visual product recognition. You will be responsible for evolving our backend to scale product data ingestion and provide low latency recognition.

If these challenges sound interesting to you, we’d love to hear from you!



Scandit is a high-growth tech scaleup from Switzerland with offices in Zurich, Boston, Warsaw, London, Tampere, Tokyo and Singapore. (Please note this role may require some travel to our Zurich office from time to time).



As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will be helping us to build a stable and scalable backend for visual product recognition. This includes making critical technological choices, design and implementing data stores and pipelines, and optimising low latency recognition services. Additionally, you'll guide and mentor other talented engineers within our team.











You are an experienced software developer who is passionate about building, shipping, and running software products in the cloud. You firmly believe in the power of small incremental changes over major rewrites and emphasise quick feedback in development processes, as well as when mentoring others. Your focus lies on producing maintainable code. You recognise that software development encompasses both technology and human interaction. While you stay on top of the latest tech trends, you value proven technologies. You thrive on tackling open problems, taking ownership and effectively overcoming obstacles.

Ideally, you:





Here are just some of the reasons why people choose to build their career at Scandit:





Could your code give superpowers? Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows and provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. This means we have no shortage of technical challenges for engineers like you. Join us, as we continue to expand, grow and innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.

We are proud to be “accredited in theandin the.

location: RELEX Solutions · Finland Reposted  6 hours ago  · 31 applicants
job_description:
About the job
RELEX Solutions create cutting-edge optimisation software to help retailers and consumer brands drive profitable growth. With growth comes opportunities, and we embrace both. Within our platforms, our teams are driving change, working with international colleagues and the latest tech stack to develop solutions that transform into a pioneering end product; it’s tangible and impactful – for our customers and the world.



Our Technology team enjoy a challenge. They’re hungry to learn, and don’t hesitate to ask what, why, and how. They get to work with various technologies to create high quality scalable applications (just imagine, thousands of stores, millions of products, and billions of rows of raw data!). Their expertise positively impacts the environment and business processes around the world; alongside international colleagues, they drive change and develop solutions that become our pioneering end product. From functional programming, machine learning and interesting algorithms, to building big data pipelines, they’re behind it all. They can work in a flexible way, remote or in-office – after all, they contribute to all our achievements, so we reward them with genuine work-life balance and access to every opportunity.

We are now looking for ato join our RELEX family in. You will be part ofof four people, who will help you succeed in your new role. Together the team is responsible for configuration and maintenance of the internal services that are crucial for the whole company and allow other teams to function effectively.















RELEXians can be found around the world, but here we’re based in Helsinki. We’re passionate about using our technology to improve sustainability and change the world. Our office provides a great space for you to socialise, exercise and even take time out in our relaxing areas. We make sure our unique approach to flexibility and work-life balance comes across loud and clear; we’re conveniently located, there’s plenty of public transport and you can even bring your pet to the office!

Across RELEX, our people are supported and rewarded. In Finland, we go even further. As well as:



We also offer a range of benefits to support you, your family, and your life situation. We value your work-life balance and provide flexible hours with RELEX specific parental leave agreements. As we’re a diverse team of smart, motivated and fun people, we also have an office gym, host monthly sports and culture events (think kayaking, brewing club and more), offer a mobile phone package and bike leasing.

We’re on a journey with our pioneering technology and exciting growth, which is why we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We can’t wait to see what challenges you’ll overcome and what problems you’ll solve. Join us and work with the best.

Being part of RELEX means being heard, feeling valued and knowing that you can be yourself because you belong. We believe in actions, not words, regarding diverse hiring and employment practices. We take DE&I seriously. We champion and benefit from global diversity. We’re creating and evolving our culture to welcome everyone and value every idea.



Please note that we will fill this position as soon as we’ve found the right person, so we recommend that you act quickly. If you have questions, Ana Raposo (ana) from our Talent Acquisition is happy to answer them via email.
See more

required_skills: Data Analytics, Databases, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), and SQLBusiness Intelligence (BI), DAX, Dashboards, Embedded SIM (eSIM), Negotiation, and SAP BusinessObjects
location: AFRY · Greater Lahti Area  3 days ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Yrityksen kuvaus

Cubiq Analytics on analytiikkatalo, jossa alan parhaat osaajat haluavat olla töissä. Tehtävämme on toteuttaa suomalaisissa organisaatioissa ennennäkemättömiä läpimurtoja datan avulla.





Onko voima kanssasi? Hyvä! Etsimme tiimiimme jo kokemusta kerryttänyttä Senior Power BI -konsulttia. Oletko sinä etsimämme vahva osaaja?

Tehtävänäsi on kehittää asiakkaillemme pilvipohjaisia analytiikkaratkaisuja Power BI:n avulla. Valomiekkoja emme tällä kertaa tarvitse, mutta Power BI:n tulisi olla hyvin hyppysissäsi. Haemmekin tiimiimme jo kokemusta kerryttänyttä osaajaa, joka hallitsee datan visualisoinnin lisäksi myös sen mallinnuksen. Senior konsulttina olet oman alasi asiantuntija ja jaat osaamistasi mielelläsi niin Cubiqin sisällä kuin asiakastöissäsi: otteesi on sparraava ja tuot aktiivisesti uusia ideoita esiin.

Power BI -tekemisemme kasvaa kohisten, mutta talostamme löytyy jo valmiiksi muita Power BI -osaajia, eikä asioita tarvitse pähkäillä ja pallotella koskaan yksin. Cubiqille tullessasi tuletkin osaksi yhteisöä. Meillä töitä tehdään vahvasti tiimeissä, ja asiakkuuden koosta riippuen tiimissäsi on monesti myös Data Engineerejä ja/tai web-devaajia. Asiakkaamme ovat suuria ja keskisuuria suomalaisia yrityksiä ja julkishallinnon organisaatioita, mikä takaa mielekkäät projektit ja oman osaamisen kehittymisen. Emme ole toimialasidonnaisia, joten asiakkaamme ja toimeksiantomme vaihtelevat laidasta laitaan. Pääsetkin laajentamaan ymmärrystäsi datan ja analytiikan arvoketjun valjastamisesta organisaation tarpeisiin hyvin monipuolisesti.

Rekrytointiprosessin aikana kartoitamme osaamistasi ja intohimoasi analytiikkaa kohtaan, jotta olisimme paras mahdollinen match toisillemme. Meillä ei ole turhaa byrokratiaa, joten rakennamme roolisi ja urapolkusi näiden keskustelujen ja kiinnostuksenkohteidesi pohjalta.












Olemme osa globaalin insinööri-, suunnittelu- ja konsultointiyritys AFRYn Management Consulting -liiketoimintayksikköä. Meillä pääset osaksi energistä ja osallistavaa yhteisöä, jossa on loistava tekemisen meininki ja työtäsi arvostetaan. Saat vaikuttaa aidosti asioihin ja luotsata omia visioitasi eteenpäin. Vapauden ja vastuun lisäksi takaamme joustavan työympäristön sekä kilpailukykyiset edut. Toimistomme sijaitsevat Helsingissä, Lahdessa, Tampereella ja Turussa.

Mitä mieltä töistään ja Cubiqista on meillä Power BI:llä päivittäin ratkaisuja tekevä Senior konsultti Johanna?

“Cubiqilla työskentelyssä parasta on työkaverit sekä vaihtelevat projektit. Monipuolisten työtehtävien ansiosta pääsen kehittämään omaa osaamistani, sillä asiakkaiden tarpeet ja ympäristöt ovat erilaisia. Välillä rakennan talouden Power BI -sovellusta ja seuraavana päivänä kehitän asiakkaan Azure-ympäristöä. Omien taitojen syventyminen onkin takuuvarmaa, ja Cubiqilla on tullut opittua lyhyessä ajassa paljon!”

Jos tulevat työkaverisi ja työkulttuurimme kiinnostavat, voit kurkata meininkiämme nettisivuiltamme https://cubiq.fi tai somekanaviltamme LinkedInistä, Instagramista tai Facebookista nimellä @cubiqanalytics.



Jos edellä kuvattu kolahti, laita hakemusta tulemaan ja liitä kylkeen CV:si. Käymme hakemuksia läpi säännöllisesti ja kontaktoimme haastatteluihin nopeasti sopivien henkilöiden osuessa kohdalle. May the force be with you!

puh. 040 066 6114 tai vesa.pukki@afry.com

: 1.11.2023

Power BI -tekemisemme kasvaa kohisten, mutta talostamme löytyy jo valmiiksi muita Power BI -osaajia, eikä asioita tarvitse pähkäillä ja pallotella koskaan yksin. Cubiqille tullessasi tuletkin osaksi yhteisöä. Meillä töitä tehdään vahvasti tiimeissä, ja asiakkuuden koosta riippuen tiimissäsi on monesti myös Data Engineerejä ja/tai web-devaajia. Asiakkaamme ovat suuria ja keskisuuria suomalaisia yrityksiä ja julkishallinnon organisaatioita, mikä takaa mielekkäät projektit ja oman osaamisen kehittymisen. Emme ole toimialasidonnaisia, joten asiakkaamme ja toimeksiantomme vaihtelevat laidasta laitaan. Pääsetkin laajentamaan ymmärrystäsi datan ja analytiikan arvoketjun valjastamisesta organisaation tarpeisiin hyvin monipuolisesti.

Rekrytointiprosessin aikana kartoitamme osaamistasi ja intohimoasi analytiikkaa kohtaan, jotta olisimme paras mahdollinen match toisillemme. Meillä ei ole turhaa byrokratiaa, joten rakennamme roolisi ja urapolkusi näiden keskustelujen ja kiinnostuksenkohteidesi pohjalta.












Olemme osa globaalin insinööri-, suunnittelu- ja konsultointiyritys AFRYn Management Consulting -liiketoimintayksikköä. Meillä pääset osaksi energistä ja osallistavaa yhteisöä, jossa on loistava tekemisen meininki ja työtäsi arvostetaan. Saat vaikuttaa aidosti asioihin ja luotsata omia visioitasi eteenpäin. Vapauden ja vastuun lisäksi takaamme joustavan työympäristön sekä kilpailukykyiset edut. Toimistomme sijaitsevat Helsingissä, Lahdessa, Tampereella ja Turussa.

Mitä mieltä töistään ja Cubiqista on meillä Power BI:llä päivittäin ratkaisuja tekevä Senior konsultti Johanna?

“Cubiqilla työskentelyssä parasta on työkaverit sekä vaihtelevat projektit. Monipuolisten työtehtävien ansiosta pääsen kehittämään omaa osaamistani, sillä asiakkaiden tarpeet ja ympäristöt ovat erilaisia. Välillä rakennan talouden Power BI -sovellusta ja seuraavana päivänä kehitän asiakkaan Azure-ympäristöä. Omien taitojen syventyminen onkin takuuvarmaa, ja Cubiqilla on tullut opittua lyhyessä ajassa paljon!”

Jos tulevat työkaverisi ja työkulttuurimme kiinnostavat, voit kurkata meininkiämme nettisivuiltamme https://cubiq.fi tai somekanaviltamme LinkedInistä, Instagramista tai Facebookista nimellä @cubiqanalytics.



Jos edellä kuvattu kolahti, laita hakemusta tulemaan ja liitä kylkeen CV:si. Käymme hakemuksia läpi säännöllisesti ja kontaktoimme haastatteluihin nopeasti sopivien henkilöiden osuessa kohdalle. May the force be with you!

puh. 040 066 6114 tai vesa.pukki@afry.com

About the job
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

We are looking for a Junior HR Business Partner at ABB Oy, Marine & Ports division in Vuosaari, Helsinki.

The position is a fulltime and permanent. In this position you will implement variety of human resources management tasks in Marine & Ports local division and work closely with Local HRBP Wilhelmina Suominen. We offer hybrid work option and wish you also enjoy working in our renovated and modern office in Helsinki, Vuosaari.

You will have an opportunity to work with skilled professionals across organization in various roles. This role offers a great learning opportunity, ability to influence and do meaningful and creative work.

Our culture and benefits reflect our values: courage, care, curiosity and collaboration. The most appreciated benefits according to our personnel are at the moment e.g. an annual performance bonus, employee share acquisition program, continuous learning opportunities, bicycle and other wellbeing and family benefits.

This position reports to

Local Division HR Business Partner

Your responsibilities



Your background



More about us

ABB Marine & Ports supplies world-leading technologies that are driving the evolution of sustainable shipping. Electrical propulsion, data-driven decision support and integrated solutions for ship and shore from ABB are paving the way to a zero-emission marine industry, providing greater efficiency and reliability to shipowners, and preparing vessels to meet the demands of tomorrow. Our automation and electrical solutions are making port and terminal operations safer, greener and more productive. ABB Marine & Ports operates in 26 countries and has 2,000 employees. www.abb.com/marine

Working with ABB Marine & Ports, you'll have the chance to make a real difference. Your efforts will help drive the transition toward sustainable and responsible practices in the maritime and port industries. Join us in creating a better, cleaner future for the planet.

In Finland, ABB has about 5000 employees, making it one of the biggest industrial employers in the country. ABB Finland serves its customers in over 20 locations and has production sites in Helsinki, Vaasa, Porvoo and Hamina. As a global company, we’re also able to offer international job opportunities.

In case you would need further information, please contact Wilhelmina Suominen, Local Division HR Business Partner, tel. +358 50 335 8759 either Friday 10 November at 2–3 pm EST or Friday 17 November at 10–11 EST.

Interested in joining the crew? Please apply for the position by Sunday November 26, 2023. We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

**This role could also be based in our Warsaw office**

At Scandit, we are developing smart data capture technology that enables smart devices to capture data from barcodes, IDs, text and objects. Our newest product, ShelfView, is a machine learning-powered platform for retail that enables real time shelf visibility and empowers more intelligent and efficient store operations. With our scalable data capture technology via robots and mobile devices, retailers are on track to save tens of millions in operating expense and in turn generate tens of million more in value for their customers. For more information, please check our product website.

We are now looking for a new colleague to join the ShelfView team and work on providing a scalable backend to power visual product recognition. You will be responsible for evolving our backend to scale product data ingestion and provide low latency recognition.

If these challenges sound interesting to you, we’d love to hear from you!



Scandit is a high-growth tech scaleup from Switzerland with offices in Zurich, Boston, Warsaw, London, Tampere, Tokyo and Singapore. (Please note this role may require some travel to our Zurich office from time to time).



As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will be helping us to build a stable and scalable backend for visual product recognition. This includes making critical technological choices, design and implementing data stores and pipelines, and optimising low latency recognition services. Additionally, you'll guide and mentor other talented engineers within our team.











You are an experienced software developer who is passionate about building, shipping, and running software products in the cloud. You firmly believe in the power of small incremental changes over major rewrites and emphasise quick feedback in development processes, as well as when mentoring others. Your focus lies on producing maintainable code. You recognise that software development encompasses both technology and human interaction. While you stay on top of the latest tech trends, you value proven technologies. You thrive on tackling open problems, taking ownership and effectively overcoming obstacles.

Could your code give superpowers? Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows and provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. This means we have no shortage of technical challenges for engineers like you. Join us, as we continue to expand, grow and innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.

About the job

At Konecranes, we believe that great customer experience is built on the people behind the Konecranes name – people committed to providing our customers with lifting equipment and services that lift their businesses. Everything we do, we do with passion and drive. 
 
 We believe diversity drives business success and is the foundation for our growth. We welcome different backgrounds and skills that enrich our community and we promote a place where we can ALL be ourselves. This is what makes Konecranes a unique place to work.

is a new global role within our Cybersecurity team. Konecranes is trusted every day to lift, handle and move what the world needs. Our goal is that customers choose Konecranes as the cybersecure option for safe and secure material handling solutions – and at the same time ensure that Konecranes itself is resilient and protected against the digital threats.




The exact scope of work can be finalized based on the candidate's experience and skills. Your ultimate goal is to help identify security risks in the factories and distribution centers and provide advisory and hands-on support for implementing the required risk mitigations while ensuring safety and reliability of Konecranes manufacturing operations.

OT Security Specialist / Engineer reports to Head of OT Security, which is also a new role at Konecranes.



To achieve these goals, you should have. You may be an experiencedwith enthusiasm towards cybersecurity. Or maybe you are anwho wants to make a career move into an interesting global company where you have a chance to influence and gain experience on multiple aspects of a global OT security program.

What matters most, is that youYou feel at ease and excited of performing OT system configuration review or supporting the analysis of cybersecurity anomalies and incidents in OT networks.



You’ll have insight into OT security development at a global scale – with an interesting product range. We’re manufacturing material handling solutions that are used in demanding environments, such as shipyards, automotive and energy industries.

a flexible work environment tailored to their life situation as well as performance-based incentives, comprehensive occupational healthcare and insurance, and the opportunity to take part in the employee stock ownership program.

OT Security Specialist is based in any of our main locations in, but it goes without saying that the remote & hybrid working is a part of our modern ways of working. The role requires(each for about 1 week), locations - Germany, Sweden, USA, Finland, Czech Republic, China, India (in total more than 30 factories or distribution centers).



If you feel curious to know more, please submit your applicationat latest via Apply -link below. We appreciate early applications, as we will start screening applicants and invite them to interview already during the application period.

Please contact the recruiting manager,, Chief Information Security OfficerorDaria Zhuravleva, Global Talent Acquisition specialist via daria.zhuravleva@konecranes.com



Konecranes is a world-leading group of Lifting Businesses™, serving a broad range of customers. We are truly a global company with 16,900 employees at 600 locations in 50 countries. For over 80 years, we have been dedicated to improving the efficiency and performance of businesses in all types of industries. We believe that sustainable growth is a result of a strong responsible performance. job_description:
About the job
Job Description

Role background

Trust and Safety is a new global team at Wolt, focused on proactively mitigating trust and safety risks on the Wolt platform. It is a key priority for us that everyone can feel safe while using Wolt - be it for ordering, delivering or selling goods.

As the Head of Global Trust and Safety, you will have the unique opportunity to drive the development and execution of comprehensive strategies, policies, and initiatives that enhance safety and trust across our entire ecosystem.

Specifically, your work will be focused on reducing trust and safety incidents - to do so you will create policies on how to operate on the platform, you will identify root causes for incidents and form cross-functional teams to solve those, and will drive initiatives to increase the sentiment of safety on the platform.

In this role, you will partner closely with various global functions (including product, operations, legal, analytics, communications, and leadership) to drive forward company-wide projects with high strategic importance.

To succeed in the role, you must be comfortable working at both ends of the spectrum - you’ll be building the high-level strategy and also rolling up your sleeves to get things done!






If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership of things you care about, and being part of an ambitious group of professionals, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for our stock option plan.

You will fit into a truly diverse team across 25 countries - what really matters to us is a caring and welcoming environment where we embrace uniqueness and celebrate diversity. Experience a company culture where we work on eye level, decisions are made quickly and knowledge sharing, as well as mentoring, is on our daily agenda.

If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to:

Enrica Testa, Senior Talent Acqusition Partner at enrica.testa@wolt.com

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!






You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.

required_skills: EnglishATEX Directives, Altium, Certification Testing, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Design, Employee Benefits, Engineering, Problem Solving, and Skill Development
location: Wapice Ltd · Tampere, Pirkanmaa, Finland  3 weeks ago  · 14 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Are you interested in playing a key role in developing state-of-the-art hardware solutions that power the future of technology? 

We are searching for you, HW Designer (ATEX)!

Wapice is renowned for its expertise in electronics, spanning a broad spectrum of industrial IO and radio interfaces, sensor and measurement electronics and embedded processor platforms. Our work ranges from Linux capable SoC´s to low-power sensor systems, and from industrial office to extremely harsh environments. We are a company that specializes in software and hardware solutions for a wide range of industries, including IoT, industrial automation and digital services. With a track record of innovation spanning over two decades, we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality customized solutions to our clients.

Read more about our team's expertise and customer solutions here.

Who are we looking for?

As an Electronics Designer you will play a key role in the design and development of advanced electronic systems and components that meet ATEX certification standards. You will work on diverse electronics design projects, some of them involve explosive atmospheres, ensuring safety, reliability and compliance with industry regulations. You are expected to conduct risk assessments for potentially explosive environments and perform testing and validation of electronic systems to ensure compliance and safety.





At Wapice we welcome everyone just the way they are, but we look for people who share our values, which are Believing in People, Succeeding Together and Passion to be Ahead. These principles are not just words; they´re embedded in our DNA. Wapiceans are doers, collaborators and problem solvers.

You can read more about our culture and working at Wapice at our career site. Check out our social media channels as well - Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, and LinkedIn.

Why join Wapice?

Wapice is a full-service software company like no other. Our solutions are used by domain leading industrial companies around the world. Our expertise ranges from electronics design, software development in embedded systems and data science up to modern mobile and cloud based software solutions. We have well defined and documented electronics design processes which help you to succeed in your role and allow you to grow your competence through collaboration with colleagues through the design process. It is also our priority to simply offer a great workplace. We offer our people several benefits, such as:



We offer permanent full-time employments but also flexible part-time opportunities if you prefer shorter hours to ensure your work-life balance. The work can be done from any of our sites in Finland (Tampere, Vaasa, Helsinki, Turku, Seinäjoki, Jyväskylä, Kuopio, Hyvinkää or Oulu) and of course flexibly remotely (in Finland), too.

Did we catch your interest?

Great! We can't wait to get to know you better. Leave your CV and salary request through our easy-to-use recruitment platform, and we'll be in touch. We will start interviews already during the application process and the position will be filled as soon as the suitable candidate is found, so be sure to apply right away..

Our recruitment process includes 1 or 2 interviews, where we discuss both technical and work personality related topics. In some cases we use small technical assignments also. Interviews are usually Teams meetings and take approx. 1,5 hours. Our goal is to keep recruitment process as simple as possible for your convenience.

Our People & Culture team is happy to answer any questions you might have about our recruitment process or about working at Wapice in general. Are you excited about our quest For a life full of flavour? Does coffee and food make your heart beat? If yes, join us!

Your position is in the Customer Experience IT team, which develops and operates Paulig’s IT services and solutions supporting all the layers related to smooth customer and consumer experience and satisfaction. This includes all the solutions and platforms used for Marketing & Innovations, Commercial teams, Customer Service and digital touchpoints exposed to our customers and consumers.

The job is permanent and located in Helsinki, Finland or in Mölndal-Gothenburg, Sweden.

About the job
JOIN YOUSICIAN

Yousician aims to impact and enrich the lives of millions of people by empowering them to learn something new, promoting their wellbeing and using their time for something meaningful. Our job is to reimagine music education, so everyone can play.

However, you don't need to be a musician to join Yousician.

We’ve built an amazing team of creative, passionate, and independent people, all working together to help millions of people learn, play, and have fun. If you are looking for a rewarding career opportunity in a growing and changing scale up business, you’re in the right place!



As a Senior Product Designer, you’ll have a unique opportunity to impact the lives of millions of future musicians worldwide and re-imagine the way we learn and play music.

You are a key player in the design process of our product Guitar Tuna (140M downloads worldwide), and play a key role in creating beautiful, enjoyable and engaging experiences for over 20 million monthly users. We are always looking for new, delightful ways to strengthen our product experience, making learning and playing music more enjoyable and engaging for our growing user base.

We are building a product that is not only functional but also fun and engaging, and as a Senior Product Designer, you'll have a chance to bring the vision to life the way you see fit.



As a Senior Product Designer, you get full ownership of your own work, and get to shape the role towards a direction that's meaningful and inspiring for you. We trust you with autonomy and freedom, and you get to drive things forward according to your vision and expertise. Your responsibilities include:













Send us your application and CV (in English). Let's make the world a more musical place together! #rockon



Yousician is the world’s largest music-tech company, with millions of users worldwide. Based in Helsinki, Finland, Yousician is home to the category-defining Yousician and GuitarTuna apps. Yousician, the #1 platform to learn and play music, makes learning fun, easy, and more accessible for everyone. Yousician’s innovative, award-winning technology listens to you play and gives instant feedback. With interactive, gamified lessons and songs, and courses by world-famous artists like Metallica and Jason Mraz, Yousician empowers people to play music they love. GuitarTuna, the #1 tune-and-play app (iOS, Android, WP), has won numerous international business awards, including WIRED’s hottest Finnish start-up, SXSW, Midem, Launch.edu, and educational awards such as Sunday Times 'World's best apps' and Best European Learning Game. Today Yousician employs 140+ professionals from nearly 30 nationalities. We're hiring, so come join our amazing team and help us make the world a more musical place!

About the job
Job ID: 19410 
 As a Senior Expert or Master Expert (depending on your experience) on the Sanctions Advisory and Risk Management team—part of Nordea’s Group Financial Crime Prevention unit—your role involves helping translate sanctions policies and regulations into action across the First Line of Defence at Nordea. You will support the Bank by identifying inherent risk that exists as part of its day-to-day business, helping to assess whether this risk is appropriately managed, and articulating residual risk once controls are considered to evaluate issues for prioritisation and closure. You will think end-to-end about sanctions risk management (run the bank) and develop processes to better identify and manage sanctions risks (change the bank). You will be motivated to help the Business Areas better manage their sanctions-related risks, both compliance and operational. You will be expected to have a strong grasp of sanctions risks, incorporate industry best practices regarding risk-assessment methods and control assessments, and drive the organisation to build sustainable capabilities.

job_title: Senior Product Manager, Campaign Overview and Reporting
required_skills: Analytics, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Product Management, and User Experience (UX)Business-to-Business (B2B), Market Planning, Product Discovery, Software as a Service (SaaS), and User Research
location: Smartly.io · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 week ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our reporting focused team called Bobby Tables. Our number-crunching service aggregates data from multiple sources within and outside Smartly.io making it one of the most data-heavy parts of the application. Customers can analyze performance of their ad campaigns by using the flexible report builder and data visualizer tool our team has developed.

Besides providing a customer-facing interface to the online analytical processing (OLAP) system that allows it to run complex analysis, the service offers programmatic access to the Reporting engine powering such features as automated actions and automated budget optimizations. The challenges lie in different areas: the scale of the database (several terabytes of data), complexity of database queries powered by flexible query language exposed as REST API, having numerous stakeholders both on client and data ingestion sides. The data structures have been evolving from being focused on one ad serving channel to being abstract cross-channel.

As a Senior Product Manager in this team, you will be leading the vision and execution of enhancing our reporting services to a whole new level. Based on feedback from our customers we want to work on even better visualization, data integrations, and data injections in our reporting services. Your role will involve analyzing these customer needs and developing a strategy to address them. You will work closely with the team to ensure the successful implementation of these changes and to deliver a high-quality reporting service that meets our customers' expectations.











Smartly.io is one of the world’s largest SaaS digital advertising platforms. We help brands better reach audiences, engage creatives and learn what performs best across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Snap, Pinterest, TikTok, and Google.

We manage nearly $5B in ad spend and help 700+ brands worldwide. Our leading end-to-end technology and outstanding customer helps brands like Walmart, FanDuel, L’Oreal, Warner Bros. Discovery, Nestle, and Disney/ESPN to better reach audiences, engage creatives and learn what performs best.

We offer growth-minded people opportunities to make an impact in a fast-paced, collaborative and inclusive environment built on a culture of trust, transparency, and feedback. You’ll work with a team of 600+ Smartlies, representing 60+ nationalities. We operate in 13 countries across 24 locations.

At Smartly.io, you can enjoy the freedom to harmonize work and personal life. As a global, hybrid organization, we are mindful to collaborate in ways that allow everyone, everywhere to be productive and feel included.

Join our global team to change the future of digital marketing!

Learn more at smartly.io/careers.

See more

location: Neste · Porvoo, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  9 hours ago  · 48 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Oletko sinä seuraava muutoksen tekijämme? 

Hei sinä, joka haluat olla mukana luomassa elinvoimaisempaa maapalloa tuleville sukupolville! Liity rohkeaan joukkoomme. Olemme maailman johtava uusiutuvan lentopolttoaineen ja uusiutuvan dieselin tuottaja sekä edelläkävijä uusiutuvien ja kierrätettyjen raaka-aineratkaisujen kehittämisessä polymeeri- ja kemikaaliteollisuudelle. Tavoitteenamme on tehdä Porvoon jalostamosta Euroopan vastuullisin. Luodaan yhdessä muutosta kohti vastuullisempaa tulevaisuutta.

Etsimme sinua



kokoaikaiseen ja toistaiseksi voimassa olevaan työsuhteeseen Porvoon Kilpilahteen suunnittelemaan ja hallinnoimaan varaosien, materiaalien ja tarvikkeiden saatavuutta. Material Plannerina olet tärkeässä roolissa varmistamassa yhdessä kunnossapidon, tuotannon, varaston ja hankintatiimin kanssa, että oikeat osat ovat saatavilla tuotantoon sovitun aikataulun puitteissa. Tehtäviisi kuuluu myös varastosaldojen ja niiden tehokkaan käytön seuranta ja raportointi.Tehtävä sijoittuu Manage & Maintain Assets -organisaatioomme.



Työskentelemme inspiroivassa ja kehittyvässä liiketoimintaympäristössä, jossa kaikella, mitä teemme, on yksi tarkoitus: luoda elinvoimaisempi maapallo tuleville sukupolville. Kasvamme uusiutuvissa ja kiertotalousratkaisuissa ja olemme vahvasti mukana vaikuttamassa tulevaisuuteen. Arvot näkyvät meillä arjessa joka päivä: me välitämme, me olemme rohkeita, me teemme yhteistyötä.

Turvallisuus on kaiken tekemisemme ytimessä. Haluamme, että työmme tuntuu hyvältä ja tekee hyvää. Me Nesteellä edistämme kulttuuria, jossa jokainen on tervetullut ja tuntee olonsa turvalliseksi ja arvostetuksi omana itsenään.

Muutos tuo uusia mahdollisuuksia ja ruokkii rohkeutta ja uteliaisuutta. Globaalisti kasvavana yrityksenä tuemme jokaisen kehittymistä monipuolisilla oppimis- ja uramahdollisuuksilla. Teemme töitä yhdessä fiksusti ja joustavasti.

Lisäksi tarjoamme nesteläisille Suomessa erilaisia etuja, esimerkiksi henkilöstörahaston osana kokonaispalkitsemista, hyvän työterveyshuollon ja laajan sairaus- tai vakuutuskassan jäsenyyden. Tuemme myös vapaa-ajan harrastusmahdollisuuksia mm. tarjoamalla liikunta- ja kulttuurietuja.

Työpaikka sijaitsee Kilpilahdessa Porvoossa noin 30 minuutin ajomatkan päässä Helsingin keskustasta. Järjestämme nesteläisille ilmaisia bussikuljetuksia Kilpilahteen pääkaupunkiseudulta sekä Porvoosta ja lähialueilta.











Mietitkö vielä, kuinka hyvin sovimme yhteen? Tee lyhyt testi!.

Haluamme kuulla sinusta lisää!

Jos sinulla on kysyttävää rekrytointiprosessista tai tehtävästä, ota yhteyttä Erkko Wiheriäkoski, Development Manager, p. +358 50 458 9803, parhaiten tavoitettavissa ke - to 15.00 - 16.30 tai lähetä sähköpostia erkko.wiheriakoski@neste.com.

Teemme parhaamme, jotta kuulet meistä viimeistään kahden viikon kuluessa hakuajan päättymisestä. Prosessiiin saattaa sisältyä haastatteluiden lisäksi soveltuvuusarviointi. Valitulle henkilölle tehdään terveystarkastus, johon sisältyy huumausainetestaus. Lisäksi valitusta henkilöstä tehdään hänen suostumuksellansa turvallisuusselvitys.



Neste tuottaa ratkaisuja ilmastonmuutoksen torjumiseksi ja kiertotalouden vauhdittamiseksi. 75 vuoden kokemuksella jalostamisesta olemme nyt maailman suurin uusiutuvan lentopolttoaineen ja uusiutuvan dieselin tuottaja sekä edelläkävijä uusiutuvien ja kierrätettyjen raaka-aineratkaisujen kehittämisessä polymeeri- ja kemikaaliteollisuudelle. Olemme asettaneet kunnianhimoiset tavoitteet ilmastolle, luonnon monimuotoisuudelle, ihmisoikeuksille sekä toimitusketjulle ja raaka-aineille. Tavoitteenamme on tehdä Porvoon jalostamosta Euroopan vastuullisin jalostamo vuoteen 2030 mennessä. Yhdessä kumppaneidemme kanssa tavoitteenamme on saavuttaa hiilineutraali ja luontopositiivinen arvoketju vuoteen 2040 mennessä. Menestystämme on luomassa 5 400 ammattilaista 16 maassa. Lue lisää:. Inspiroidu.

job_title: Patient Care Digital Solutions Architect (f/m/d) - EMEA
required_skills: Consultative Selling, Deal Closure, Executive Relationships, Key Accounts, Lead Qualification, Market Analysis, Relationship Development, Resource Allocation, Sales Negotiation, and Sales Strategy
location: GE HealthCare · Finland Reposted  1 week ago  · 24 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Job Description Summary 

The Patient Care Solutions (PCS) Digital Solutions Architect - EMEA is responsible to develop and grow our Digital PCS business in Europe, by engaging with our region GM’s and commercial teams as well as the global product management focusing on the long-term success of GE HealthCare’s relationship with our customers in order to sell GE HealthCare (GEHC) Digital Patient Care Solutions and increasing GEHC’s share of wallet. Acting as an expert in the field with breadth and/or depth on Anaesthesia & Intensive Care segment, a solid product and associated digital services knowledge and experience will be necessary to execute the job. The future incumbent (f/m/d) will be successful when thinking innovatively on possible business models, driving market penetration in Europe, revenues, and margin across the entire solutions portfolio.This role is remote based and can be based in any European country!At GE HealthCare, our machines, our software, our solutions, our services, and our people make a genuine difference to medical professionals and patients all over the world. That’s because we never lose sight of what healthcare really needs—the human touch.















Are you interested in learning more? Then we are looking forward to your online application!



GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator with over 100 years of healthcare industry experience and around 50,000 employees globally. We enable clinicians to make faster, more informed decisions through intelligent devices, data analytics, applications and services, supported by our Edison intelligence platform. We operate at the center of an ecosystem working toward precision health - digitizing healthcare, helping drive productivity and improving outcomes for patients, providers, health systems and researchers around the world.

Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. location: Wolt · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  5 days ago  · 45 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Job Description

Are you an experienced legal professional seeking a challenging role within data protection? Are you passionate about privacy and working in a fun environment while solving complex issues? If this sounds like you, then read further!



Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to home or to the office. We’re one of Europe’s fastest growing companies and currently we operate in 25 countries. Our local commerce platform makes it easy for customers to order whatever they need on one app, for merchants to make additional sales, and for couriers to make meaningful earnings flexibly. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local commerce platform to retail software and financial solutions, as well as operates its own grocery stores.

For us privacy and security are core elements of everything we do to ensure we can operate and scale. We’re now looking for an experienced, pragmatic and technically-minded data protection professional to join our privacy team within Wolt Legal & Public Policy function. You would participate in the development of our data protection practices and provide support in day-to-day privacy legal matters across countries, different business functions and multiple data subject groups. The scope of the role and responsibilities may be tailored depending on your experience level.

We’re looking for someone who has the ability to tackle complex privacy issues across different countries and business functions. A person who is able to maneuver multiple cases and stakeholders simultaneously, understand core business needs and support our people with the Wolt way of doing things will excel in this role. In this position you get to influence how to improve processes and scale our way of working. At the end of the day we are looking for an enabler with an entrepreneurial mindset and solution-driven ways of working. Our ideal team member has an ability to be close to our business, is dynamic and proactively gets things done. We also appreciate quick thinking and a can-do attitude of rolling up one's sleeves, no matter the task or if it is in one's comfort zone or not.

In this role, you will be ideally located in Helsinki. However, we are also open to consider other EU countries where Wolt operates.













If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for our stock option plan.

If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to:

Kalle Sundell, Talent Acquisition Partner - ta-hq@wolt.com

Please note that. You should submit your application through our careers website!









You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.

location: Unity · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  9 hours ago  · 38 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We believe work is better when people are in the same physical space together. At Unity, we offer a hybrid-first approach that fosters the alignment and connectedness we get from being together while retaining the benefits of flexibility. Employees are expected to work from an office on average 3-days a week unless otherwise agreed with the company or specified in their employment contract.



We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our Unity Monetization team. You will be responsible for growing our Campaign Management & Optimisation products, utilising synergies with other products & teams on our platform. Our team is always passionate about improving our advertisers’ experience, so we hope to find someone who can get behind that mission and build exciting products!

In this role, you will draw upon your past experience working with all aspects of product management from research to roadmapping. We value prior experience in mobile advertising, user acquisition, and advertising technology in a fast-growth company or a software startup. We are also super interested in inquisitive and passionate people above all. In addition to your solid understanding of product and Ads, you’ll use your communication skills, both in writing and in person to work closely with data scientists, engineers and most of all our other product teams across the globe! Helping bring new services to market!


















Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world’s most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2022, more than 70% of the top 1000 mobile games were made with Unity as derived from a blended number of the top 1000 games in the Google Play Store and Apple App Store. In 2022, Made with Unity Applications had more than 4 billion downloads per month. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

job_description:
About the job
Job Description

We are looking for a Product Lead to join the Merchant Group, Engagement Team. Merchant products are at the foundation of Wolt. Our mission is to make Wolt an integral part of our merchants' daily lives. We give them tools and automation that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use. Our products are built around reliable effective self-service, which helps us keep trust at the core of our partner relationships.

The Product Lead for the Merchant Engagement Team will work on building products that will enable strong long-term relationships with our merchants, ensure our platforms are built to scale and we drive a strong engagement with our entire merchant base. Topics include increasing Merchant selection, helping maximize success & retention, and ensuring high performance so Wolt customers have the best food delivery and shopping experience possible.

As a Product Lead, you will work with a cross-functional team of incredibly talented engineers, designers, product people and analysts in a high-visibility role. You will be responsible for defining the roadmap and setting the vision for your team. This involves our Merchants better than anyone and leading multiple projects and cross-team product initiatives across the entire product lifecycle to build solutions for them.

Your home base will be Wolt’s product management team but you will be working on a daily basis not only with the engineering team but also with the business operations and country teams, who are responsible for the global and local businesses. The domain is relatively new with green field opportunities to develop a vision, strategy, and lead teams in building brand-new impactful experiences for our Merchant community.

📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland & Germany.



You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have





The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Elif Dilan Ayaz (elifdilan.ayaz@wolt.com).

location: Metsä Group · Espoo, Uusimaa, Finland  1 day ago  · 7 applicants
job_description:
About the job

This recruitment is carried out anonymously.

We are looking for a




to manage Metsä Group level Integrated Business Planning development in future.




Metsä Group is implementing world-class core processes and we need excellent competencies to support the change. We see Supply Chain as one of core processes to have significant impact to industrial efficiency.

In your role you will lead Integrated Business Planning sub-process team across process area and business area boundaries according to Metsä Group process governance. The Supply Chain development roadmap provides clear target and focus until 2030. You will be a part of Metsä Group Business Process Development Team and in addition you will participate in Metsä Group Supply Chain Business Process Core team.

Development of Integrated Business Planning process touches many other processes and thus gives you an excellent opportunity to expand your competencies in this role. Integrated Business Planning is an area which has significant potential in improving efficiency and customer experience.

Your location will be in Espoo, Finland. You will report to VP, Group Business Process, Supply Chain.

Main responsibilities:






To succeed you will need versatile skills in business process development, change management, data harmonization and project management. When working in Metsä Group you are leading a process team covering several Group Business Areas. We expect you to have skills in self-leadership and be a person to take initiatives. Good skills in effective communication as well as the ability to generate enthusiasm and work in a multi-cultural matrix environment are a must.

We value your understanding of Supply Chain operations as well as deep understanding of Integrated Business Planning processes, operating models and related systems. In addition, we value good educational background (e.g. M.Sc. or equivalent) and fluency in English. Other languages are seen as additional asset.




Renewal is vital: for the forest and for us. Metsä Group offers many opportunities for professionals who genuinely want to develop sustainable products and the business. Our responsible operations and high quality products are both a source of pride for all of us in Metsä.

Forest plays a major role in the lives of everyone. Watch the video to see how The future is made by Metsä!



This recruitment is carried out anonymously. Therefore, the following information will be hidden from the recruiters until the interview stage: name, date of birth, contact details, gender, mother tongue, dates of education and name of the educational institution. Attachments (CVs) are also hidden. HR recruiters have access to the applicants' contact details at the stage when they start inviting applicants for interviews.

Our recruiting system will guide you through the application process. You will be asked for personal data, but all the above mentioned information is hidden from the recruiters until the interview stage.

The application form includes questions to help you to present your skills and experience anonymously. Please reply to all questions to make your competences and skills visible. You can attach a CV to your application, but it is hidden at the initial stage of the recruitment process. If you are invited for an interview, recruiters will have access to your CV to support the interview.

Read more about our anonymous recruitment at https://www.metsagroup.com/careers/work-with-us/anonymous-recruitment/




Vaula Raassina, Development Manager, Sales & Operations Planning (tel. +358 50 5989689 ) is happy to tell you more about your future role and our expectations for a new teammate. Vaula is best available on 8.11 / 9.11 / 15.11 at 9-11 EET.




Submit your application using the link "Apply". Please note that attachments are not visible in anonymous recruitment, so it is important to complete the application form carefully. Please submit your application as soon as possible, as we will start processing the applications already during the application period. Include your CV and tell us your salary request.

The search is open until 23.11.2023. Hear you soon!
